title: Album Page, "Tile Floor in Oratory, Blois", May 6, 1888
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: 29; lower right corner: 27; above drawing: Tile floor in / Oratory - / 1/4 full size - 0.25 = 1 M / Blois / May 6th 1888 / Note: the blue and yellow are / not dark enough.
description: Vertical sheet illustrating  a tile floor pattern.  Three bands of alternating brown and blue squares frame the lower right corner of tilework in shades of blue, white, and golden yellow.  The central tiles create a diamond pattern of alternating blue and white diamond-shaped tiles, tiles with a yellow fleur-de-lys on blue ground, and tiles with a yellow rosette and stylized yellow fleurs-de-lys radiating from the cardinal points. The colors are much more muted than those depicted in 1943-51-199.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Tile Floor in Oratory, Blois", May 6, 1888.Brush and watercolor, graphite on off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-200.
